sub_topic: Finding the chromatic index of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

![Graph Image](https://i.imgur.com/W1iHtZc.png)

What is the chromatic index of the graph?
message_2:
The chromatic index of a graph is the minimum number of colors needed to color its edges such that no two adjacent edges share the same color. In the given graph, we can see that it is a complete graph with 4 vertices, also known as K4.

In a complete graph, every vertex is connected to every other vertex. The chromatic index of a complete graph K_n is given by the formula:

chromatic index = n if n is odd,
chromatic index = n - 1 if n is even.

Since the given graph is K4, which has an even number of vertices (n = 4), the chromatic index is:

chromatic index = n - 1 = 4 - 1 = 3.

So, the chromatic index of the given graph is 3.
